document.docAuthor: Rakhshani, Ehsan, Talebi, Ali Asghar, Starý, Petr, ‚, Tomanovi, Kavallieratos, Nickolas G. & Manzari, Shahab
document.masterDocTitle: A review of Aphidius Nees (Hymenoptera: Braconidae: Aphidiinae) in Iran: host associations, distribution and taxonomic notes

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of Aphidius Nees (Hymenoptera: Braconidae: Aphidiinae) in Iran: host associations, distribution and taxonomic notes

heading.emphasis:
Key to
Aphidius
species in Iran (based on adult females)

paragraph.keyLead:
1 Anterolateral area of petiole rugose (Fig. 58 )
............................................................ Aphidius ervi
Haliday

3 Antenna 15 -segmented; metacarpus as long as or slightly shorter than pterostigma length (
Fig. 26
); labial palpus with two palpomeres (
Fig. 3
)
................................................................. Aphidius colemani
Viereck

- Antenna 16–17 -segmented; metacarpus about half of pterostigma length (
Fig. 38
); labial palpus with three palpomeres (
Fig. 6
)
..................................................................................... Aphidius transcaspicus
Telenga

7 Antennae 14–15 -segmented; pterostigma elongately triangular, as long as metacarpus (
Fig. 30
); ovipositor sheath short (
Fig. 67
)
................................................................................ Aphidius matricariae
Haliday

- Antennae 16–17 -segmented; pterostigma widely triangular, 1.9–2.4X as long as metacarpus (
Fig. 31
); ovipositor sheath elongate (
Fig. 68
)
.................................................. Aphidius persicus
Rakhshani & Starý
- Tentorial index <0.6; face sparsely pubescent with glabrous middle area................................................ 10

11 Ovipositor sheath elongate and strongly prominent (
Fig. 66
)
......................... Aphidius funebris
Mackauer

14 Pterostigma widely triangular, 2.8–3.1X as long as its width (
Fig. 40
)
Aphidius uzbekistanicus Luzhetzki

15 Antennae 16–17 -segmented; ovipositor sheath widening sharply toward base (
Fig. 70
); pterostigma slightly longer than metacarpus (
Fig. 33
)
...................................... Aphidius rhopalosiphi
De Stefani-Perez

- Antennae 17–18 -segmented; ovipositor sheath widening weakly toward base (
Fig. 76
); pterostigma equal to or slightly shorter than metacarpus (
Fig. 39
)
.................................................... Aphidius urticae
Haliday

16 Pterostigma 1.8–2.1X as long as metacarpus (
Fig. 27
)
.................. Aphidius eadyi
Starý, González & Hall

- Pterostigma 1.3–1.5X as long as metacarpus (
Fig. 37
)
.................... Aphidius smithi
Sharma & Subba Rao
